message.content:
cs.LO, cs.FL, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the expressive power of logical formalisms over discrete structures, which is a topic that falls under the scope of several sub-categories in computer science. However, the focus on the membership problem and the search for a more suitable alternative suggests that the paper is more closely related to the areas of logic (cs.LO) and formal languages and automata theory (cs.FL). The paper also mentions recent results on the quantifier alternation hierarchy of first-order logic, which is a topic in computational complexity (cs.CC). Additionally, the investigation of the covering problem involves the development of a mathematical framework and methodology, which could be relevant to the sub-categories of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
